ECDSA - Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm

Imagine you have a private key, essentially your password. From this private key you can mathematically generate a public key such that it is impossible for someone to find out your private key using that public key.
Using your private key, you can "sign" a message to prove that you (the identity associated with your public key) is the one who sent it.

The private key is simply one number, while the signature and public key is only two nnumbers. Of course, the numbers are very large - 256 bits long or up to 10**79 We simply use the magic of cryptography to ensure that these systems remain practically uncrackable!
